text: INF3707 – Database Design and Implementation – Oct/Nov 2015 Page 1 of 6 Question 1 – MCQ 1.1 Which of the following functions can be used to return a specified portion of a character string? (A) SUBSTRING (Does not exist) (B) SUBSTR (C) POS (Does not exist) (D) INSTR FUNCTION RESULT DESCRIPTION PAGE # SUBSTR(‘HelloWorld’,1,5) Hello Extracts a string of determined length 3-11 INSTR(‘HelloWorld’, ‘w’) 6 Finds the numeric position of a named character 3-11 1.2 Which of the SQL commands is used to manipulate Oracle Database structures, including tables? (A) Data Description Language (B) Data Definition Language (C) Data Retrieval Language (D) Data Manipulation Language B (http://www.sanfoundry.com/oracle-sql-mcqs-ddl-command/ or http://www.informit.com/articles/article.aspx?p=31475 or http://www.geekinterview.com/question_details/3587) 1.3 After creation, the structure of a table can be modified using the command (E) ALTER TABLE[TABLENAME] INF3707 – Database Design and Implementation – Oct/Nov 2015 Page 2 of 6 1.4 Evaluate the following statements CREATE TABLE digits (id NUMBER(2), description VARCHAR2(15)); INSERT INTO digits VALUES(1, ‘ONE’); UPDATE digits SET description = 'TWO' WHERE id=1; INSERT INTO digits VALUES (2,'TWO'); COMMIT; DELETE FROM digits; SELECT description FROM digits VERSIONS BETWEEN TIMESTAMP MINVALUE AND MAXVALUE; After execution, what would be the result of the above query? (A) It displays the value TWO thrice (B) It displays the value TWO twice (C) It displays no value (D) It produces an error 1.5 Which of the following statements correctly grants a system priviledge? (A) GRANT CREATE TABLE TO user3, user5; 1.6 Consider the following SELECT statement SELECT constraint_name, constraint_type, search_condition, r_constraint_name, delete_rule, status FROM user_constraints WHERE table_name = 'EMPLOYEES'; Select the statement that is true about the output generated by the query above. (A) The column search_condition decides the state of the related rows in the child table (B) The r_constraint_name column gives the alternative name for the constraint (C) The STATUS column indicates the usability of the table (D) The second column indicates a check constraint 1.7 Which of the following options states the two classes of privileges? (A) System and Object 1.8 Evaluate the following DELETE statement DELETE FROM departments; Assuming there are no other uncommitted transactions on the departments table, which statement is true about the DELETE statement? (C) It removes all the rows in the table and allows ROLLBACK 1.9 Consider the structures of the departments and employees tables. Select the appropriate set operator to fill the blank in the statement below that can be applied to display the departments where all employees have managers SELECT department_id FROM departments ____________ SELECT department_id FROM employees WHERE manager_id is NULL (D) Union INF3707 – Database Design and Implementation – Oct/Nov 2015 Page 3 of 6 Question 2 2.1 SELECT (last_name || ' , ' || job_id ) "Examination and Title" FROM employees; 2.2 SELECT last_name "Employee", salary "Monthly Salary" FROM employees WHERE salary BETWEEN 3000 AND 12000 AND department_id IN (20, 50) ORDER BY last_name; 2.3 SELECT last_name FROM employees WHERE last_name LIKE '__a%'; 2.4 SELECT column_name, data_type, data_length, data_precision, data_scale, nullable FROM user_tab_columns WHERE UPPER(table_name) = '&tab_name'; 2.5 ALTER TABLE jobs MODIFY (MIN_SALARY VARCHAR2(15), MAX_SALARY VARCHAR2(23) ); Question 3 3.1 SELECT INITCAP(last_name), LENGTH(last_name)"Length" FROM employees WHERE last_name LIKE 'K%' OR last_name LIKE 'E%' OR last_name LIKE 'M%' ORDER BY last_name; 3.2 They requested the use of the CASE function SELECT job_id "Job",(CASE job_id WHEN 'AD_PRES' THEN 1 WHEN 'IT_PROG' THEN 2 WHEN 'SA_REP' THEN 3 WHEN 'ST_CLERK' THEN 4 WHEN 'ST_MAN' THEN 5 ELSE 0 END) "Grade" FROM employees; Same as above but using DECODE function SELECT job_id "Job",decode (job_id, 'AD_PRES', 1, 'IT_PROG', 2, 'SA_REP', 3, 'ST_CLERK', 4, 'ST_MAN', 5, 0) "Grade" FROM employees; INF3707 – Database Design and Implementation – Oct/Nov 2015 Page 4 of 6 3.3 SELECT COUNT(*), SUM(DECODE(TO_CHAR(hire_date, 'YYYY'), 1987,1,0))"1987", SUM(DECODE(TO_CHAR(hire_date, 'YYYY'), 1989,1,0))"1989", SUM(DECODE(TO_CHAR(hire_date, 'YYYY'), 1990,1,0))"1990", SUM(DECODE(TO_CHAR(hire_date, 'YYYY'), 1991,1,0))"1991" FROM employees; 3.4 CREATE VIEW NEW_DEPARTMENT AS SELECT department_id, department_name, Manager_id FROM departments; 3.5 SELECT * FROM NEW_DEPARTMENT; Question 4 4.1 Not validated Option 1: select last_name "Last name", department_id "Dep ID" from employees where department_id in (select department_id from employees where last_name = &last_name); Option 2: SELECT last_name, hire_date FROM employees WHERE departmant_id = (SELECT department_id FROM employees WHERE last_name = '&last_name') AND last_name <> '&last_name'; Option 3: SELECT last_name, hire_date FROM employees WHERE department_id IN (SELECT department_id FROM employees WHERE last_name = :last_name) AND last_name <> ':last_name'; Option 4: SELECT e.last_name "Name", e.department_id "Department", c.last_name "colleague" FROM employees e JOIN employees c ON (e.department_id = c.department_id) where e.employee_id <> c.employee_id; 4.2 SELECT last_name, hire_date FROM employees WHERE department_id IN (SELECT department_id FROM employees WHERE last_name = :last_name) AND last_name <> ':last_name'; INF3707 – Database Design and Implementation – Oct/Nov 2015 Page 5 of 6 4.3 SELECT Country_id, country_name FROM countries MINUS SELECT country_id, country_name FROM countries NATURAL JOIN locations NATURAL JOIN departments; Question 5 5.1 5.2 Not validated create table locations1 (location_id number(4)not null unique, postal_code number(4), city varchar2(30), state_province varchar2(25) constraint pk_location primary key(location_id), references locations(location_id)) Option 2 CREATE TABLE LOCATIONS1 AS SELECT location_id, postal_code, city, state_province FROM locations 5.3 CREATE USER Allan IDENTIFIED BY password123; INF3707 – Database Design and Implementation – Oct/Nov 2015 Page 6 of 6 5.4 GRANT create session, create table, create sequence, create view to Allan; 5.5 grant update (employee_id, first_name) on employees to Allan;
